ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] About loot order
ygData.msgSnippet: Sure, everyone deserves their fair share of the loot. Every gem can be bought at a vendor though with the exception of Blue Diamonds, Diamonds, Black Sapphires
ygData.messageBody:
Sure, everyone deserves their fair share of the loot.
 
  Every gem can be bought at a vendor though with the exception of Blue Diamonds, Diamonds, Black Sapphires and Jacinth ( you can buy fire opals from the guy in Temple of Sol. Ro.).  Pelts you can not buy and I don't think any pelts sell for more than a few gold where as gems do.  Also I don't think anyone but a tailor would keep an pelt but the HQ ones.  They don't stack and weigh quite a bit.  Gems stack and weigh .1
 
Mu
-----Original Message-----
From: LeSamLam@... [mailto:LeSamLam@...]
Sent: Friday, May 04, 2001 9:49 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] About loot order

So the next time I'm grouped with a tailor and he asks for the pelts I should
say no?  The good groups I've been in will share the stuff needed for a
person's certain trade skill.  They were getting some nice loot and alot of
it while I was medding.  I didn't care about the bronze and fs.  I did care
about being in on the pages and the gems.  I don't see anything wrong with
wanting to be able to loot some of that.

Lena


Please don't tell me your going to claim that because your a jeweler you
should have gotten the gems before the others.  The pages yes, they should
have gone to you no questions asked.  But the gems, with the exception of
Jaspers/Peridots maybe.

Mu
